newsitem.title: FRANCE: Thomson mood pushes Lagardere to new highs.
newsitem.headline: Thomson mood pushes Lagardere to new highs.

text.p: French missiles-to-magazines group Lagardere surged to new highs on the Paris stock exchange early on Tuesday, with traders attributing the rise more to its plans to take over Thomson SA than its higher first-half results.
The share hit a new high of 186.0 francs in early trading before easing a little to 182.8 francs, up 3.51 percent at 0907 GMT, with more than a million shares changing hands.
"Nobody cares about the results, it's the Thomson story that counts," said one trader, noting foreign investor interest.
Lagardere earlier announced a first-half net attributable profit of 409 million francs, up from 296 million francs, and forecast full-year net attributable of one billion.
The group had already added a further 6.26 percent on Monday to 176.60 francs, after emerging as the government's preferred bidder in the Thomson privatisation.
It also said on Monday that its Matra -BAe Dynamics joint venture won a Thai missile order whose value was estimated by industry sources at between 100 and 500 million francs.
